intro: Conobea scoparioides, commonly known as the long-stemmed conobea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Conobea scoparioides is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
